name: 2,6-dimethoxybenzoyl chloride
Reason: 2,6-dimethoxybenzoyl chloride has a melting point that can be predicted by considering its structural components: (1) The basic unit is benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5°C. (2) The two methoxy groups increase the melting point due to their ability to participate in hydrogen bonding, estimated at around +10°C each. (3) The chlorine atom introduces a polar functional group, which can form hydrogen bonds and increase the melting point, estimated at around +5°C. (4) The benzene ring itself contributes to the melting point due to its planarity and rigidity, estimated at around +20°C.
